tool.name: Align.check
tool.description: Calculate the number of potentially misaligned bases
tool.command: mothur_wrapper.py --cmd='align.check' --result='^mothur.\S+\.logfile$:'$logfile,'^\S+\.align\.check$:'$out_file --outputdir='$logfile.extra_files_path' --fasta="$fasta" --map="$ss.map" #if $count.__str__ != "None" and len($count.__str__) >0: --count="$count" #end if #if $count.__str__ != "None" and len($count.__str__) >0: --name="$name" #end if

param.name: map
param.label: map - Select a secondary structure map

param.name: count
param.label: count_table file
param.help: You can also provide a name file associated with your fasta file

param.name: name
param.label: names file
param.help: The count file is similar to the name file in that it is used to represent the number of duplicate sequences for a given representative sequence

tool.help:
@MOTHUR_OVERVIEW@
**Command Documenation**
The align.check_ command allows you to calculate the number of potentially misaligned bases in a 16S rRNA gene sequence alignment using a secondary_structure_map_. If you are familiar with the editor window in ARB, this is the same as counting the number of ~, #, -, and = signs.
.. _secondary_structure_map: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Secondary_structure_map .. _align.check: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Align.check
